resources.string: When turned on, the camera will be stretched to full screen and the navigation buttons will be hidden
When turned on, the camera will fit into the screen based on the size of the phone\'s matrix.\nAllows you to see the entire photo area without cropping the sides of the photo.
After taking a photo, you will be able to view result of the photo to make sure that the photo is not blurred, with the option to delete it.
Using the phone\'s rear camera, if available, Otherwise-a front-facing camera for taking selfies.
Allow you to switch the camera between the back and front.
Allow you to take several photos per session, with the return of an array of images.

Instead of actually taking photos and waiting for the camera to return the image, a snapshot of the area that displays the image is used.\nMuch faster than a real photo, does not give the sound of taking a photo, but the size of the photo is limited by the size of the screen. Also, you cannot turn on the auto flash, only torch mode allowed.
Usually frontal photos need to be mirrored in order to be displayed to the user. If you uncheck this box, the photos will remain original, without mirroring.
In the Camera 2 implementation, a black background is displayed when switching cameras. This checkbox allows you to show a blurred snapshot from the last camera instead.
Allows you to save photos, in addition to the app\'s memory, also to the phone\'s gallery for the user.
Blocks rotation of the camera activity and redrawing of the view when the phone is rotated.

The old camera implementation for Android 4 devices. Does not support multiple cameras on the same phone facing, may not support optical stabilization and other improvements. If turned off, Google\'s CameraX implementation will be used if possible on current device
